titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4616

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.

WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A. Crittenden, Clerk.
Wm. L. Harlan, Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.

Frankfort, Ky., 27 February, 1864.
His Excellency
Tho. E. Bramlette.
Sir.
The Sheriff of Kenton S. F. Roberts has paid the Revenue Int & Costs for 1862. for which Judgement was rendered.
He Sheriff above desires to be released of the Damages viz $1058.57.

Please Send me remission.
Your Truly
W. T. Samuels
Auditor

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Sheriff Kenton
Damages
Remitted
27th Feby 1864
